title: Interest Rate Swap Fixed Leg
notes: This equation calculates the present value of the fixed leg of an interest rate swap. PV_fixed represents the present value

title: Interest Rate Swap Floating Leg
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps

title: Swap Value at Inception
notes: This equation calculates the value of a swap at inception. V_swap represents the swap value

title: Par Swap Rate
notes: This equation calculates the par swap rate (the fixed rate that makes the swap value zero at inception). R_swap represents the par swap rate

title: Swap Value After Inception
notes: This equation calculates the value of an existing swap. V_swap represents the current swap value

title: Swap DV01
equation_latex: DV01_swap = sum_{i=1}^n (delta_{i} * DF_{i} * N) - sum_{i=1}^n (delta_{i} * DF_{i} * N)
notes: This equation calculates the DV01 (dollar value of a 01 basis point change) of a swap. DV01_swap represents the sensitivity of the swap value to a 1 bp change in rates. For a par swap

title: Swap Duration
equation_latex: D_{swap} = (sum_{i=1}^n t_{i} * delta_{i} * DF_{i}) / (sum_{i=1}^n delta_{i} * DF_{i})
notes: This equation calculates the duration of a swap. D_swap represents the swap duration

title: Swap Convexity
equation_latex: Conv_{swap} = (sum_{i=1}^n t_{i}^2 * delta_{i} * DF_{i}) / (sum_{i=1}^n delta_{i} * DF_{i})
notes: This equation calculates the convexity of a swap. Conv_swap represents the swap convexity

title: Forward Rate Agreement Payoff
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a Forward Rate Agreement (FRA). Payoff represents the FRA payoff

title: Swap Spread
notes: This equation calculates the swap spread. Spread represents the difference between the swap rate and the treasury rate of the same maturity. The swap spread reflects credit risk and liquidity differences between the swap market and the treasury market.

title: Cross-Currency Swap
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps

title: Cross-Currency Swap FX Leg
equation_latex: PV_{foreign} = X_{0} * sum_{i=1}^n (N_{foreign} * R_{foreign} * delta_{i} * DF_{foreign}
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps

title: Cross-Currency Swap Value
notes: This equation calculates the value of a cross-currency swap. V_ccs represents the swap value

title: Asset Swap
notes: This equation calculates the asset swap spread. Spread represents the spread that makes the bond price equal to par when combined with an interest rate swap. Asset swaps are used to convert fixed-rate bonds to floating-rate exposure.

title: Total Return Swap
equation_latex: Payoff = (Bond Return + Coupon - LIBOR - Spread) * N
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a total return swap. Payoff represents the periodic payment

title: Inflation Swap
notes: This equation gives the payoff of an inflation swap. Payoff represents the periodic payment

title: Amortizing Swap
notes: This equation calculates the present value of an amortizing swap. PV represents the present value

title: Accreting Swap
notes: This equation calculates the present value of an accreting swap. PV represents the present value

title: Forward Swap Rate
notes: This equation calculates the forward swap rate for a swap starting at time t and ending at time T. F_swap represents the forward swap rate

title: Caplet Payoff
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

title: Cap Price
notes: This equation calculates the price of a cap as the sum of caplet prices. C represents the cap price

title: Caplet Price (Black Model)
equation_latex: Caplet = N * delta * DF * [F * N(d_{1}) - K * N(d_{2})]
notes: This equation prices a caplet using the Black model. Caplet represents the caplet price

title: Black Model d_1
notes: This equation defines the d_1 parameter in the Black model for interest rate options. d_1 combines the moneyness (ln(F/K))

title: Black Model d_2
notes: This equation defines the d_2 parameter in the Black model. d_2 is simply d_1 minus sigma * sqrt(T). d_2 represents the probability that the option will be in the money under the forward measure.

title: Floorlet Payoff
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

title: Floor Price
notes: This equation calculates the price of a floor as the sum of floorlet prices. F represents the floor price

title: Collar Price
notes: This equation calculates the price of a collar. Collar represents the collar price

title: Swaption Payoff (Payer)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

title: Swaption Price (Black Model)
equation_latex: Swaption = N * (R_{swap} * N(d_{1}) - K * N(d_{2})) * sum_{i=1}^n delta_{i} * DF_{i}
notes: This equation prices a European swaption using the Black model. Swaption represents the swaption price

title: Receiver Swaption Payoff
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

title: Bond Option Payoff (Call)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

title: Bond Option Price (Black Model)
notes: This equation prices a European bond option using the Black model. C represents the call option price

title: Callable Bond Pricing
notes: This equation prices a callable bond. B represents the callable bond price

title: Puttable Bond Pricing
notes: This equation prices a puttable bond. B represents the puttable bond price

title: Vasicek Model
notes: This is the Vasicek one-factor short rate model. dr represents the change in the short rate

title: CIR Model
equation_latex: dr = a(b - r)dt + sigma * sqrt(r) * dW
notes: This is the Cox-Ingersoll-Ross (CIR) one-factor short rate model. The model is similar to Vasicek but with a square-root diffusion term that prevents negative interest rates. The CIR model is widely used for its realistic properties and analytical tractability.

title: Hull-White Model
notes: This is the Hull-White extension of the Vasicek model with time-dependent parameters. theta(t) is a time-dependent function chosen to match the initial yield curve exactly. This flexibility makes Hull-White popular for calibration to market data.

title: Hull-White Theta Function
notes: t) + (sigma^2 / 2a) * (1 - exp(-2at))

title: LIBOR Market Model
equation_latex: dL_{i}(t) = L_{i}(t) * mu_{i}(t)dt + L_{i}(t) * sigma_{i}(t) * dW_{i}(t)
notes: This is the LIBOR Market Model (LMM) for forward LIBOR rates. dL_i(t) represents the change in the i-th forward LIBOR rate

title: LMM Correlation
notes: This equation defines the correlation structure in the LIBOR Market Model. rho_{ij} represents the correlation between the Wiener processes driving different forward rates. Correlation is crucial for pricing multi-period derivatives like swaptions.

title: LMM Caplet Price
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Models

title: LMM Swaption Pricing
notes: This equation approximates a swaption price as a weighted sum of caplets in the LIBOR Market Model. S represents the swaption price

title: Gaussian HJM Bond Price

title: SABR Model
notes: This is the Stochastic Alpha Beta Rho (SABR) model for forward rates. dF represents the change in the forward rate

title: SABR Volatility
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Models

title: SABR z Parameter
notes: This equation defines the z parameter in the SABR volatility formula. z combines the log-moneyness ln(F/K) with the volatility parameters alpha and sigma. The z parameter is used in the SABR volatility calculation.

title: SABR x(z) Function
equation_latex: x(z) = ln((sqrt(1 - 2 * rho * z + z^{2}) + z - rho) / (1 - rho))
notes: This equation defines the x(z) function in the SABR model. x(z) is a transformation that ensures the volatility formula is well-behaved. rho is the correlation parameter between the forward rate and volatility.

title: Swap Rate Dynamics
notes: This equation models the dynamics of the swap rate. dS represents the change in the swap rate

notes: This is the Cheyette model

notes: This is the Quadratic Gaussian model

title: Inflation Swap Price
equation_latex: P = sum_{i=1}^n (N * R_{fixed} * delta_{i} * DF_{i}) - sum_{i=1}^n (N * I_{i} * delta_{i} * DF_{i})
notes: This equation prices an inflation swap. P represents the swap price

notes: This equation gives the payoff of a yield curve steepener trade. Payoff represents the trade payoff

title: Yield Curve Flattener Trade
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a yield curve flattener trade. Payoff represents the trade payoff
